episodes.title: 14: Cults from the Victim's Perspective (Jonestown Massacre 47th Anniversary)
episodes.description: Don't just remember the tragedy—understand the trap. Author and Academic, Annie Dawid, talks about the true and often-ignored story of the Peoples Temple. We discuss the inner circle of Jim Jones, the racism and strict hierarchy hiding behind the promise of "equality," and the lasting impact on Guyana. A vital look at cult dynamics that serves as a chilling reminder: no one is immune. More about Annie: https://www.anniedawid.com/ "Kenny Winking": https://inkspotpublishing.com/writer/kenny-winking-a-short-story-by-annie-dawid/ Black Jonestown: https://www.youtube.com/@UCfxmOgWz0-B7RuN4PZhX8gw Books mentioned in this episode:Annie Dawid's "Paradise Undone": https://amzn.to/4o3pEloWilson Harris's "Jonestown": https://amzn.to/4pgGC0K Inkspot Publishing receives a commission for any Amazon sales made through the above affiliate links. The Indie Books Club is a podcast dedicated to discussing books of all kinds, usually from Indie presses. We'll talk about books that make us think, chat with guests from the publishing world, and more. Hosted by Cathy Evans and brought to you by Inkspot Publishing, we aim to enrich your day with interesting arguments, unfiltered thoughts, and a few jokes! Inkspot Publishing Website: https://inkspotpublishing.com/ Amazon Affiliate Page: https://www.amazon.co.uk/shop/inkspotpub?ref_=cm_sw_r_cp_ud_aipsfshop_FCBRWQP5VFZXGXDTTN2B_1 Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/inkspotpub/ Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/inkspotpublishing/ X: https://www.twitter.com/inkspotpub/ Threads: https://www.threads.net/@inkspotpub Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/company/inkspot-publishing/posts/?feedView=all Produced and edited by Taryn de Meillon #IndieBookClub #BookPodcast #BookTube #ReadingCommunity #AmReading #FictionLover #Storytelling #LiteratureLover #Bookish #WritingCommunity #Novels #Bookstagram #PopCultureBooks #podcast #publishing #literature #freespeech
